intro: Lecanorchis multiflora var. brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited twayblade, is a rare orchid species native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is a terrestrial orchid with a short, hairy stem and a single, lance-shaped leaf. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in a spike, and it is often found in shaded, moist forest environments. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique morphology and limited distribution. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species in many regions.
